intro: Phyllepidum, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often waxy leaves and showy, spadix-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Phyllepidum species are perennial herbs that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Botanically, they are notable for their complex reproductive structures and their ability to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
